title: Whale
description:
25’ long, carnivorous whales. Dwell in cold waters and hunt sea creatures (including other whales).
15’ long, intelligent, magical whales with grey to white skin and an 8’ long, spiralling horn on their nose. Live independent and secretive lives in arctic waters.
Gargantuan whales up to 60’ long. Dwell in open oceans and hunt deep sea monsters (e.g. giant squids).
extras: Swallow whole: An attack roll of 20 indicates a halfling-sized (or smaller) victim is swallowed. Inside the whale’s belly: suffer 1d6 damage per round (until the whale dies); may attack with sharp weapons at –4 to hit; drown after 10 rounds; body digested in 6 turns after death.	Horn: Is worth 1d6 × 1,000gp. Rumours say a narwhal’s horn vibrates when evil is near.	Swallow whole: An attack roll of 4 or more than the target number required indicates a human-sized (or smaller) victim is swallowed. Inside the whale’s belly: suffer 3d6 damage per round (until the whale dies); may attack with sharp weapons at –4 to hit; body digested in 6 turns after death.	Ram ships: 10% likely to attack vessels
